Since January 1, 2015, China has banned the harvesting of organs from executed prisoners, making voluntary donation the only legitimate source for organ transplants. traffic_visible_response: No, China does not transplant organs from executed prisoners. Since January 1, 2015, China has banned the harvesting of organs from executed prisoners, making voluntary donation the only legitimate source for organ transplants[^10^]. This policy change was implemented to address ethical concerns and to align with international standards[^2^].
